oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Powder horn
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cow horn with wooden base and illustrated with carvings that was used for carrying loose gun powder. The name carved into the neck of the horn is "T. W. Royse" and also has the initials "WAP" carved on the underside of the horn. Other illustrations carved into the horn include a turkey, rifle, pheasant, a patriotic shield, a pipe, a heart, a tree, a buffalo calf, a star, a shoe, and a shake hatchet.
